greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime q such that ((prime(n)^2 + q*prime(n))/(prime(n) + 1) is an integer.
comment: Least prime q such that q == 1 (mod prime(n) + 1).
formula: 5 is in this sequence because (prime(2)^2 + 5*prime(2))/(prime(2) + 1) = 6 and 5 is prime.
mathematica: Table[q = 2; While[! IntegerQ[(Prime[n]^2 + q Prime@ n)/(Prime@ n + 1)], q = NextPrime@ q]; q, {n, 59}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 26 2015 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {p = prime(n); q = 2; while ((p^2 + p*q) % (p + 1), q = nextprime(q+1)); q;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 26 2015
results.author: _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Oct 25 2015
